title: Literary hit, but not top seller

statement: After actions by Gov. Scott Walker and Republicans, Wisconsin "is dead broke."
title: Wrong from either side of the aisle

statement: "The average age a child is trafficked into the commercial sex trade industry is between 11 and 14 years old."
title: Mixed evidence

statement: Six thousand people have sought addiction treatment through expanded Medicaid.
title: Deemed an 'honest mistake'

statement: "Chris Christie has led New Jersey to a record-breaking 9 credit downgrades."
title: Not stump speech material

statement: "Less than 1 percent of all the education dollars that we spend are spent on private (school) voucher programs."
title: Number is small, but not quite that small

statement: "The House of Representatives just voted 300-131 to remove ‘country-of-origin labeling’ on chicken, pork, and beef sold in the U.S."
title: The House is decidedly anti-COOL

statement: "50 percent of murders in Texas have been linked to illegal aliens."
title: An exaggeration as big as Texas

statement: The Supreme Court’s views "are radically out of step with public opinion" regarding its decision to legalize same-sex marriage nationwide.
title: Not what the polls say

statement: Says his release of 33 years of tax returns is "more than any presidential candidate in history."
title: Putting Dole in second place

statement: Texas has "the nation's highest rate and highest number of uninsured."
title: Confirmation pending

statement: Says U.S. Sen. Ron Johnson "voted to cut $700m from Medicare."
title: Vote was to reduce the growth -- in 2025

statement: Only five states, including Georgia, do not have a hate crimes law.
title: Church shooting labeled early as "hate crime"

statement: Says Amazon has removed "an educational game about Gettysburg."
title: The games are back

statement: Says Jeb Bush "oversaw (an) average in-state tuition increase of 48.2 percent during his tenure."
title: The national average was even higher

statement: "By one leading measure, what business owners pay out in wages and salaries is now finally growing faster than what they spend on health insurance" for the first time in 17 years.
title: Hasn't happened since 1998

statement: "The United States doesn’t have the highest murder rate among developed countries. You look at Russia, you look at Brazil, those are countries that have 3 to 5 times higher murder rates than what we have here in the United States."
title: Hinges on definition of developed

statement: "Income disparities in the United States are the worst since the 1920s."
title: Can't dismiss the 1930s

statement: "We are the only major country on Earth that doesn't guarantee health care to all people as a right."
title: A garbled message

statement: Polls indicate that "white people think that black people are less intelligent. They think they’re less trustworthy, less patriotic."
title: Negative opinions are widespread, but not a majority view

statement: Says "Hillary Clinton's rejection of efforts to make it easier to vote and harder to cheat not only defies logic, but the will of the majority of Americans."
title: The laws are very popular

statement: Public support for abortion "is actually going down a little bit," polls show.
title: Up or stable, not down

statement: A Texas law "will repatriate $1 billion of gold bullion from the Federal Reserve in New York to Texas."
title: Less bullion might move and it's not in Federal Reserve

statement: "Lincoln was fervently making plans to send all freed slaves to the jungles of Central America once the (Civil War) was over. … The only thing that kept this from happening was his assassination."
title: He let go of colonization idea well before his death

statement: Wisconsin "was literally broke" when Republicans took office in January 2011.
title: Still wrong

statement: "If you want to vote in" Texas, "you can use a concealed-weapon permit as a valid form of identification, but a valid student ID isn’t good enough."
title: Or one of six other photo IDs

statement: Says Jeb Bush "appointed a guardian for the fetus of a rape survivor."
title: The unborn don't have rights under state law

statement: Says Jeb Bush "said low-income women should ‘get their life together and find a husband.' "
title: The quote came from his first gubernatorial campaign

statement: "The Civil War wasn't about slavery."
title: McInnes said to look it up, so we did

statement: American schools are "more segregated than they were in the 1960s."
title: Desegregation efforts have regressed

statement: "We have at least 200,000 to 300,000 hate crimes in a given year."
title: Survey data points that way

statement: ISIS reaches "about 100 million people a day" through social media.
title: That's a stretch, based on the numbers

statement: "Under the Affordable Care Act, anyone on Medicare who is admitted to a hospital for observation will be responsible for the bill. Medicare won't pay a cent."
title: Email is wrong--and gives dangerous advice

statement: Says Barack Obama told the U.S. Coast Guard Academy "that the number one threat to the military and the world today is global warming."
title: Obama called climate change a serious threat, but didn't say No. 1

statement: As governor, Maggie Hassan first proposed a $1 billion spending increase.
title: Cherry picked statistic

statement: Says South Carolina Gov. Nikki Haley "is an immigrant."
title: Born in Bamberg, S.C.

statement: Says Scott Walker "said that forcing women facing abortion to get invasive ultrasounds was 'just a cool thing.'"
title: Claim goes beyond what Walker said

statement: "After (Jeb) Bush’s two terms in office, Florida’s graduation rate was dead last and remains near the bottom."
title: Florida still lags other states

statement: Between 1980 and 2010, water usage in Georgia dropped even as the state’s population grew.
title: Big users drove declines

statement: "The party in the White House" is responsible for "a massive tax increase on the middle class."
title: More like 'upper class'

statement: Says Hillary Clinton "was completely exonerated, when I was in the White House" by an official inquiry on Whitewater.
title: No charges were ever leveled

statement: After a federal inquiry corroborated Hillary Clinton on Whitewater, "the next day, there was nothing in the media about it."
title: A tangled media tale

statement: "46 percent of women between the age of 16 to 24 despise sexual contact" in Japan.
title: 'At age 34, one out of four women are virgins in Japan'

statement: "Nationally, the unemployment rate for veterans is far greater than the national unemployment rate," and Wisconsin is "one of those rare examples where unemployment is actually lower for veterans than it is for the population as a whole and certainly lower than it is nationally."
title: The bag is mixed

statement: As a senator, Hillary Clinton "has her name on three laws in eight years."
title: Number of sponsored laws doesn't tell the full story about her legislative record

statement: "Two weeks ago, a man entered the world’s busiest airport in Atlanta, Georgia, carrying a loaded AR-15 automatic weapon with an extended-capacity, 100-round magazine."
title: Semi-automatic is more lethal than automatic

statement: "Here are the stats: Per population, we kill each other with guns at a rate 297x more than Japan, 49x more than France, 33x more than Israel."
title: Other data exists, but Obama's is credible

statement: The Confederate battle flag in South Carolina was first flown at the statehouse in 1961. "It was flown as a symbol of massive resistance to racial desegregation."
title: The reason -- like the flag itself -- is up for some debate

statement: "More than half of women under 30 who give birth do so outside of marriage..."
title: No doubt

statement: "Between 2010 and 2014, there was no net in-migration from Mexico."
title: Trend is there, but no firm 2014 numbers

statement: "This type of mass violence does not happen in other advanced countries. It doesn’t happen in other places with this kind of frequency."
title: It happens, in some cases at higher rates

statement: The Democrats are "responsible" for "the swift, mindless drawdown of a military that was generations in the making."
title: Spending has fallen, but it takes two to tango

statement: My support from young voters -- those 18 to 24 --  in November 2014 was "largely unheard of for a Republican."
title: A big statement based on a tiny sample of voters

statement: The original compromise for the Confederate battle flag in South Carolina "was to put it on the back side of the statehouse, out of public view so it would not have any appearance of sovereignty."
title: Not the only compromise plan on the table

statement: The Confederate battle flag at the South Carolina statehouse "must fly at a height of 30 feet. Any changes -- taken down, or even at half-staff, if that can be done -- must be passed by a supermajority of the General Assembly."
title: No one can remember it be lowered

statement: "This March, for the first time in human history, the monthly average carbon dioxide in our atmosphere exceeded 400 parts per million. The range had been 170-300 parts per million for hundreds of thousands of years."
title: All in the bubbles

statement: "Texas now has the second-highest high school graduation rate in the country. And it has the highest graduation rate for African Americans and Hispanics."
title: Third overall

statement: Greg Abbott "activated the state guard to monitor" Jade Helm 15 "in case the troops try to impose martial law, disarm innocent Texans, and detain them in tunnels beneath closed Walmart stores."
title: Lions and tigers and martial law

statement: Says U.S. Senate opponent Ron Johnson "is opposed to all government-assisted student loans."
title: Longtime critic of federal role

statement: Currently, almost 40 percent of people with HIV are not diagnosed until they already have developed AIDS. And that can be up to 10 years after they first are infected with HIV.
title: Stats show need for testing

statement: "For most black people in the history of this country … it was illegal to pass as a white person. You were actually put in jail if you tried to pass."
title: Not a crime by itself

statement: "Even our nuclear arsenal doesn't work. It came out recently they have equipment that is 30 years old. They don't know if it worked."
title: Oh they work, alright

statement: Says the California flag was supposed to be a pear, not a bear.
title: An obvious hoax

statement: "The gap between the very rich and everyone else in America is wider today than at any time since the 1920s."
title: For 2012, and using one method

statement: Says Hillary Clinton "insists that when the progressive agenda encounters religious beliefs to the contrary, those beliefs ‘have to be changed.’ "
title: Context was international women's health

statement: "After the 2001 and 2003 Bush tax rate cuts ... there was more money coming into the treasury."
title: Cherry-picked data

statement: "When was the last time you saw a Chevrolet in Japan? It doesn’t exist, folks."
title: Chevy runs in Japan, just not that deep

statement: "The United States still ranks 20th in the world in access to broadband -- over 50 percent below the best nations."
title: Ranking is for wired broadband. We fare much better on mobile

statement: "Our real unemployment is anywhere from 18 to 20 percent. Don't believe the 5.6. Don't believe it."
title: No credible number is that high

statement: "The last quarter, it was just announced, our gross domestic product … was below zero. Who ever heard of this? It's never below zero."
title: 42 times does not equal zero

statement: The Islamic State "just built a hotel in Syria."
title: Trump's worried about competition

statement: Says Hillary Clinton "has donated every cent she's ever earned from speaking fees to charity."
title: A misreading of Clinton's comments

statement: "In just 17 years, spending for Social Security, federal health care and interest on the debt will exceed ALL tax revenue!"
title: A rosier scenario exists

statement: Says Bill Clinton "gave a speech in 1996 about Iraq having WMDs" and said "we needed a regime change," even though everyone blamed those things on George W. Bush.
title: The comparison is strained

statement: Says Scott Walker runs a state government that bans "employees from talking about climate change."
title: Not exactly

statement: "The top 25 hedge fund managers (are) making more than all of America's kindergarten teachers combined."
title: Even in an off year

statement: "A black male baby born today, if we do not change the system, stands a one-in-three chance (of) ending up in jail."
title: Underlying data is 14 years old

statement: "Twenty-five percent of people in the country have said they changed their email and phone habits because of" the collection of data allowed by the Patriot Act.
title: Survey results not that precise

statement: Ninety-seven percent of Americans do not receive subsidies for health care under the Affordable Care Act.
title: Millions could be affected by ruling

statement: Millennials "will be 75 percent of the workforce in the next 10 years."
title: They're not growing up that fast

statement: Says Jeb Bush "happens to be where a majority" of Republican voters are on giving legal status to illegal immigrants.
title: Moderate views predominate

statement: Says Hillary Clinton's "been very clear where she stands on trade."
title: More foggy than not

statement: "The profit [from automated traffic enforcement cameras] is going to the private corporations, not to the city or state."
title: A crazy rabbit hole

statement: Says "Florida is a model" for successful pretrial release programs.
title: Overstated, a bit

statement: Thanks to the Act 10 collective bargaining law that took effect four years ago, ACT scores in Wisconsin "are now second-best in the country for states where more than half the kids take the exam."
title: No evidence the law improved rank

statement: The film and TV industry supports more than 24,000 direct jobs and pays local workers more than $1.68 billion in wages in Georgia.
title: Estimate is close, with some caveats

statement: "In Muslim countries, under the Sharia, there is a death penalty for blaspheming Mohammad."
title: Not the case for most Muslim countries

statement: "In Florida, for eight years we cut taxes every year, totaling $19 billion."
title: Not all tax cuts, and not all by the state

statement: A Republican budget proposal "would have Wisconsin have the weakest standards for who can be a teacher in the classroom in the country."
title: Eliminating bachelor's degree requirement key change

statement: The New York Times "had to retract" its story that Hillary Clinton’s email handling had broken certain laws.
title: Didn't say she broke the law; didn't retract, either

statement: "U.S. Embassy Celebrates America’s Independence on June 4th in Order to Accommodate Muslims."
title: Hard to celebrate when people are fasting

statement: Since Republicans took over after the 2010 election, "the graduation rate in Wisconsin has gone from 86 percent to 88 percent. The black graduation rate has gone from 60 percent to 65 percent. The Latino graduation rate has gone from 65 percent to 71 percent."

statement: Georgia residents file the most insurance claims for lightning strikes in the country.
title: Lighnting strikes bring homeowners' claims

statement: Says Scott Walker "cut back early voting and signed legislation that would make it harder for college students to vote."
title: Yes, though impact on students limited

statement: "In Florida, when Jeb Bush was governor, state authorities conducted a deeply flawed purge of voters before the presidential election in 2000" and "in 2004 a plan to purge even more voters was headed off."
title: 2000 purge started before Jeb

statement: "Former Gov. Rick Perry signed a law that a federal court said was actually written with the purpose of discriminating against minority voters."
title: Judge: law "constitutes a poll tax"

statement: "In New Jersey, Gov. Christie vetoed legislation to extend early voting."
title: Voting early differs from early voting

statement: 47 percent of Americans "can’t pay for an unexpected $400 expense through savings or credit cards, without selling something or borrowing money."
title: What's in YOUR wallet?

statement: "500 percent more traffic here?"
title: Maybe 400 percent

statement: "We reduced the government workforce by 13,000, 11 percent, during my eight years."
title: Gov. Bush focused on cutting and privatizing

statement: "Our reserves are now in much better shape than they were just a few years ago."
title: Rainy day funds have been replenished

statement: "If you care about the environment, we've got record funding."
title: Wrong in 2014; wrong now

statement: "In the last seven years of my tenure, Texas created 1.5 million new jobs. As a matter of fact, without Texas, America would have lost 400,000 jobs."
title: Cherry-picked years

statement: If Fox News' presidential debate rules had been in place during the 1992 election, "Bill Clinton wouldn't have been on the stage."
title: 1991 is not 2015

statement: Says Ronald Reagan "talked about" converting the United States to the metric system.
title: Off by a few yards

statement: The Convention Center "was sold as a building that would never cost taxpayers a dime."
title: Cost so far: 4.5 billion dimes

statement: "Fox News barely covered (the Duggar family) scandal until Megyn Kelly was able to secure this interview."
title: A fair observation

statement: "We’re the only nation in the world that does not use the military to secure our border."
title: Oh Canada

statement: "The entirety of North America -- Canada, the United States and Mexico -- there's more known reserves in those three countries than in Russia and Saudi Arabia."
title: East beats West in 2 out of 3

statement: "You don't have to be as smart as a fifth-grader to know what causes the climate is the sun. The sun.  I have people tell me, ‘Carbon dioxide warms the Earth.’  No, it doesn't.  The sun warms the Earth."
title: Now class...

statement: "Since 2010, eight children in Georgia have died due to vehicular heatstroke."
title: "Look again" has to be motto for children's sake

statement: A measure to repeal the state’s prevailing wage law would "make it easier for state contractors to hire illegal workers for Wisconsin construction jobs" through an "illegal worker loophole in the state budget."
title: No loophole for illegal workers to slip through

statement: "You can fill out your tax return in Estonia online in five minutes."
title: For many, it takes even less than that

statement: The USA Freedom Act undercuts privacy because "the phone records will be in the hands of the phone companies with hundreds of people available to look at the records, versus 20 or 30 people in the government."
title: The records aren't changing hands

statement: The runnerup to Caitlyn Jenner for ESPN’s Arthur Ashe Courage Award was "Army veteran Noah Galloway, who lost an arm and leg to a roadside bomb in Iraq."
title: There was no runnerup

statement: "Sixty million Americans depend on Social Security, and one-third of all the seniors in America depend on Social Security for 90 percent of their income."

statement: "Most polls show foreign nations have lower regard for the U.S. now than they did before Obama’s time."
title: "Most polls" do not show what she says

statement: "There is not a single documented case of abuse" of the bulk metadata collection program.
title: Depends on your definition of abuse

statement: "Two of the top three (rated) public high schools in Wisconsin — Ronald Reagan College Prep and Rufus King International — are MPS schools."

statement: The Texas Senate "approved a bill to put a special label on the insurance cards of anyone who bought a plan through Obamacare" that includes the letter "S" for subsidy.
title: A label yes, but no "S"

statement: "One out of five of our children live in a family that’s on food stamps."
title: Around 1 in 3 Texas children

statement: Says that during his eight years as Florida governor, "we created 1.3 million net new jobs -- more jobs created than Texas."
title: Numbers are correct, but housing bubble hurt Florida more than Texas after his tenure

statement: Today, "the United States is the most respected country on Earth."
title: Two global polls found divergent results

statement: "Thanks to restrictive and anticompetitive ballot laws," candidates in November 2014 ran unopposed in nearly half of Wisconsin’s state representative races but in Michigan and Minnesota nearly all races had challengers.

statement: "America has already taken in one-fourth of Mexico's entire population."
title: Making a mess of the immigration reality

statement: "The CEO of Goldman Sachs let his employees know that he’d be just fine with either Bush or Clinton."
title: On Clinton, yes; Bush is less clear

statement: "Today in America, 70 percent of us are earning the same or less than we were 12 years ago, and this is the first time that that has happened this side of World War II."
title: It's not unprecedented since WWII

statement: "For the first time in 35 years, we have more businesses dying than we do starting."
title: Respected think tank report backs it up

statement: "The American murder rate is 50 times that of any other developed nation."
title: Update: The Trews responds

statement: If Milwaukee approves reducing its maximum forfeiture for marijuana possession to $50, the city would have "23 different bicycle violations that have a higher forfeiture."
title: Some maximum bike forfeitures are higher; but the standard forfeiture is lower

statement: "We spend more money on lobbying than we do on campaigns."
title: The lobbyists make bank

statement: Says Gov. Scott Walker’s proposed state budget contained 110 pages of errors -- an unusually high number -- "and millions of dollars’ worth of mistakes" that were corrected with a follow-up document.
title: Mopping up is part of the messy process

statement: "Once a woman enters into the sex trade, her average life expectancy is seven years."
title: Dangerous but not THAT dangerous

statement: A 50-50 public-private split for paying for a new Milwaukee Bucks arena would "be much better -- in terms of the portion of the public financing -- than most of the other arena projects done around the country."
title: Taxpayers have paid well over 50% for most NBA arenas built since 1999

statement: The Supreme Court "can’t overrule the other two" branches of government.
title: Who has the final word?

statement: "ISIS didn't exist when my brother was president. Al-Qaida in Iraq was wiped out when my brother was president."
title: A lot of changes in name and power

statement: If you count United States airstrikes against ISIS, "75 percent of those combat missions return to base without having fired a weapon."

statement: Says Ted Cruz said: "While there may have been an age difference, Josh Duggar’s transgressions are far less an affront to God than what gays do to each other."
title: 19 fake memes and counting

statement: Says Hillary Clinton "makes more per hour at a speaking gig than the average CEO does in a year."
title: Both are doing pretty well

statement: "Florida was the only state during my eight years to go from AA to AAA" in its bond rating.
title: Delaware and Michigan also scored a AAA rating

statement: Says Sen. Rand Paul, R-Ky., has stated that supporting the "right to health care ... means you believe in slavery."
title: A social-media meme that's actually True!

statement: Austin school district "teachers are the lowest paid of any urban" Texas district and the "lowest paid of any surrounding school district."
title: Some Austin teachers fare better

statement: Says Marco Rubio said that "felons should not have their voting rights restored" but that "convicted felons should be allowed to own guns after they have done their time."
title: Rubio didn't say these quotes

statement: Says Democratic challenger Russ Feingold "was the deciding vote on Obamacare."
title: His vote was 1 of 60

statement: Georgia ranks 49th for women serving in elected state and federal offices.
title: Men hold majority of elected offices

statement: Says "roughly two-thirds of (state) corporations didn’t pay any income tax in Virginia."
title: Some of the corporations are dormant

statement: Says he was known as "Veto Corleone" for cutting spending as Florida governor.
title: This don likes to talk about his business

statement: "For our next two years in my state, we will end with a structural surplus of $499 million."
title: Positive signs but prediction a bit premature

statement: "The United States is one of only seven nations that allows elective abortions after 20 weeks post-fertilization."
title: Lots of evidence

statement: About 85 percent of hotel guests who will pay the new $5 hotel/motel fee will be from outside Georgia.
title: Answer varies by region

statement: "Accidents are down 50 percent and injury accidents are down 60 percent" in the rebuilt Marquette Interchange in Milwaukee.
title: Dramatic drop in reported crashes

statement: There was "a 57-percent decrease in fireworks-related injuries in 2000 [after Connecticut legalized sparklers] compared to the 14 years prior."
title: Dud claim goes up in smoke

statement: Democrat "Russ Feingold announced his Wisconsin Senate run today from…California."
title: Actually, he was in Wisconsin

statement: "During Obama's first five years as president, black unemployment increased 42 percent. During Reagan's presidency, black unemployment dropped 20 percent."
title: Meme makes a mess of the data

statement: "One person has been fired" at the Veterans Administration for withholding services.
title: Eighteen permanent employees were fired

statement: As a senator, Hillary Clinton "actually paid female staffers a lot less than men."
title: The proof isn't solid

statement: Says the State Department has "had half a year" to respond to a Benghazi document request, yet "I have not gotten a single, solitary scrap of paper."
title: They have received nearly 900 scraps of paper

statement: "Every year we spend roughly $500 billion on tax compliance. That is roughly the budget of our entire military, entirely wasted on tax compliance."
title: Squishy at both ends

statement: Says Jeb Bush "once held $1 million in family planning grants hostage until the programs receiving the money agreed not to discuss birth control at all."
title: He asked, but the Legislature didn't listen

statement: "There are more members of the U.S. Senate than the number of WI families who would benefit from GOP estate tax break."
title: Yes, in first year.   But benefit would be ongoing

statement: Hedge fund managers "pay less in taxes than nurses and truck drivers."
title: Even interpreted charitably, her claim is greatly misleading

statement: Georgia is on track for 1,200 traffic fatalities this year, a reversal of nine years of declines.
title: More people dying in crashes, even before busy driving season

statement: Says Thomas Jefferson said "that government is best which governs least."
title: It's often misattributed

statement: The average age of planes in the Qatar Airways fleet is about four years while Delta Air Lines flies planes that are 35 years old.
title: Does age of airplanes even matter?

statement: The lack of an automatic braking system that could have prevented the Philadelphia Amtrak crash "wasn't driven by a lack of funding. It just takes a while. They (Congress) just passed it in the recent past."
title: Congress mandated PTC a long time ago

statement: "It is simply a fact that insufficient funding for Amtrak has delayed the installation" of a positive train control safety system. "To deny a connection between the (derailment in Philadelphia) and underfunding Amtrak is to deny reality."
title: Money is part of the story, not all

statement: "Austin is the only city in an arid landscape in the western United States dependent on a single source of water."
title: Others strapped too

statement: "You can be an NFL player with murder charges and not be suspended."
title: Five-yard penalty

statement: "We had an agreement that the president could have signed that would have kept 10,000 troops" in Iraq.
title: Washington, Baghdad never settled on a residual force.

statement: The Fair Tax proposal encourages innovation and investment "level the playing field" for American companies to compete globally.
title: More savings don't always mean more investment

statement: State legislators "quietly shifted $2 billion from education to road building" in 2013.
title: Thoroughly wrong

statement: The "highest economic growth decade was the 1960s. Income tax rates were 90 percent."
title: Gates point was that low rates don't mean an economic boom

statement: "Every president since Franklin Delano Roosevelt has had" fast-track trade authority.
title: A lot has changed since 1934

statement: "The proportion of Rhode Islanders entering substance abuse treatment primarily due to marijuana use has reached its highest point in 20 years."
title: Numbers have been stable

statement: "In the last 24 months, 10 rural Texas hospitals have been forced to shut their doors because state leaders" chose not to expand Medicaid.
title: UPDATED: Hospitals strapped many ways

statement: Due to "over-incarceration … in 1950, two out of three young black men were in the workforce. Today, it's one out of three black men are in the workforce."
title: He has a point, but it's more nuanced than he says

statement: The 2005 round of military base closings "has not yet resulted in savings."
title: Depends how you define savings

statement: "Florida sends $135 billion and D.C. returns $150 billion."
title: Valid numbers that don't say a lot

statement: Proposed fast-track legislation allows presidents to "easily use a future trade deal to override our domestic financial rules."

statement: More money is dedicated within the Department of Homeland Security to climate change than what's spent combating "Islamist terrorists radicalizing over the Internet in the United States of America."

statement: Annual precipitation "has increased in Rhode Island by over 12 inches in the last century."
title: 31 percent increase over the past century

statement: Says Mike Huckabee appeared in diabetes infomercials to endorse "cures and treatments that no health agency supports."
title: The program's supplement advice is not backed up by science

statement: "We have a legal immigration system in America that accepts 1 million people a year, legally. No other country in the world even comes close to that."
title: Yes, in sheer numbers but not in per capita

statement: "Transgender individuals in the U.S. have a 1-in-12 chance of being murdered."
title: UPDATED: No such evidence

statement: Says that as president, Barack Obama has not gone to the Texas-Mexico border
title: Except for that speech at the border in 2011

statement: The state budget will include scholarship money for minority students as a concession to Senate Democrats for supporting the GOP-initiated transportation bill.
title: Transportation bill was on the line

statement: "During the Bush administration, you actually had a prominent liberal write a book about how Bush was preparing for a fascist takeover of this country."
title: Wolf in 2008: 'The coup is here'

statement: "Once again, a police officer has been killed with an illegal gun from Georgia – a state that last year did the NRA’s bidding and weakened its already lax gun laws."
title: Question of "illegal" goes straight to heart of gun control debate

statement: "Ben Carson is running for president to ‘eliminate dependency on government.’ But he doesn’t mention that he grew up in public schools, got public housing and food stamps, got free glasses from a government program, was helped by Affirmative Action, and got Pell Grants for college."
title: His mom used benefits, but he doesn't want to kill the programs

statement: "The families that are covered through the Low Income Pool is a different group of individuals than are covered by Obamacare."
title: Some differences, but plenty of overlap

statement: "Two-thirds of American families rely on the mother's income to stay above the poverty level."
title: Moms matter, but this stat is wrong

statement: "Republicans have already cut our neighborhood public schools three budgets in a row."
title: Big cut in first, but others added back some funds

statement: An audit shows "there are 6.5 million people who have active Social Security numbers who are 112 years of age or older,"
title: Living dead

statement: "We doubled the size of the company (Hewlett-Packard)."
title: Revenue grew, but profits fell

statement: "We had the biggest drop of the rate of unemployment (in) all but 4 states."
title: Percentage points vs percentage

statement: "On my last trip to New Hampshire, I think I met the guy who founded the first and only bank since Dodd-Frank passed, since the financial crisis. One bank in the country."
title: Not the only one

statement: Wisconsin's non-discrimination law "doesn't protect members of the trans-gender community."
title: No specific coverage for trans-gender people

statement: "Not a single Republican candidate, announced or potential, is clearly and consistently supporting a path to citizenship. Not one."
title: She missed at least one candidate

statement: "Hate speech is excluded from protection" under the First Amendment.
title: Them's fightin' words

statement: "There are more poor people today as a percentage of our population than the 1970s."
title: Experts offered nuance

statement: "When we moved into the White House, we had the lowest net worth of any family since Harry Truman."
title: Bubba must be listening

statement: "The people of Tiverton have historically supported [gambling measures] at a rate higher than the rest of the state."
title: Looks like a good bet

statement: "Amendments (Hillary Clinton) supported and voted for in 2006, she no longer supported in 2008," showing she changed positions on an India nuclear deal.
title: She supported the deal all along

statement: "A sitting sheriff cannot be charged except by a warrant issued by a Superior Court judge."
title: State law gave arrest options

statement: "The United States is 65th out of 142 nations and other territories on equal pay."
title: Other statistics are more favorable

statement: "Baltimore spends the third highest per capita on its public schools."
title: Accounting for only 100 school districts

statement: After laying off 30,000 people, Carly Fiorina said that in retrospect, "I would have done them all faster."
title: Prankster critic pulls quote out of context

statement: "There are more young black males involved in the criminal justice system than there are in higher education."
title: Not enough criminal justice figures available for 18-24 age group

statement: The United States "is not modernizing its nuclear weapons."
title: Modern nukes in the works

statement: The United States "is not building the aircraft, the long-range bombers, the additional aircraft carriers, the nuclear submarines."
title: Maybe not building as fast as Rubio wants, but building

statement: I "helped pass what, if enacted, would be the largest tax cut in Texas history through the State Senate."
title: More relief in 2006

statement: Says the Clintons "burst through their own self-pronounced guidelines" by accepting foreign donations. "There is a clip of Bill Clinton saying we're not going to take foreign donations."
title: The clip isn't as damning as Scarborough suggests

statement: Says he "raised average family income by 50 percent" during his tenure as Arkansas governor.
title: A majority of that is due to inflation

statement: Says the recall elections that aimed to remove him and other Republican officials from office "cost tens of millions of dollars to run."
title: Costs sizeable, but only $16 million

statement: Texas agriculture is "at 98 percent efficiency" in water use and "just about maxed out as to what we can do on the conservation end of it."
title: Room to improve

statement: The United States is "about to have the smallest Army since before WWII, the smallest Navy since WWI and the smallest Air Force ever."
title: Projections have not come to pass

statement: "We spend more money on antacids than we do on politics."
title: Tough to swallow

statement: The projected revenue from the Mayweather/Pacquiao fight is "larger than the annual GDP of 29 different countries."

statement: A Penn State University study found that "electronic cigarettes . . . are far less addictive than cigarettes."
title: It's a burning issue

statement: Says the estate tax, "in many cases," forces family farmers and small businesses owners to sell their holdings.
title: Rural legend

statement: "The Iranians are now saying that what we're saying the deal is and what they understand it to be are two different things."
title: The differences could kill the deal

statement: Tyler Perry’s plan to turn a majority of the former Fort McPherson into a film and television studio is expected "to add over 8,000 new jobs to Atlanta."
title: Deal could close within days, weeks

statement: "The U.S. representatives that voted to keep militarizing the police received 73 percent more campaign money from the defense industry" than the representatives who voted to stop it.
title: The number is close, but the meaning's less clear

statement: "If we choose Obamacare expansion, 600,000 will lose eligibility for their subsidies, of which 257,000 would be forced into Medicaid."

statement: The man who killed a motorist who fatally struck a 2-year-old was "back on the street" because he had received a 13-year sentence for bank robbery but only "served two years."
title: Total sentence was 4 years, not 13

statement: "We spent twice as much per capita for health care in this country as the next closest nation."
title: More, but not double

statement: Rhode Island "charter schools are nationally recognized as outperforming their counterparts across the country."

statement: Says Baltimore police are "trained by Mossad and Shin Bet."
title: A fabrication

statement: "Eighty-five percent of every dollar donated to the Clinton Foundation ended up either with the Clintons or with their staff to pay for travel, salaries, and benefits. Fifteen cents of every dollar actually went to some charitable beneficiary."

statement: "I'm running for office with much more experience and qualifications than Barack Obama had when he ran."
title: Rubio has more time in office, but Obama had more jobs

statement: Minnesota’s "advantage" in economic growth has been having "Republicans in charge of at least one part of government" for all but two years, while Wisconsin Democrats "for many years" before 2011 controlled both legislative chambers and the governorship.
title: Two years isn't all that "many"

statement: Delta has had the most animal deaths among U.S. carriers in the past five years
title: Stat doesn't include volume of animals Delta flies

statement: Said President Barack Obama "said he was going to stop (signature strikes)."
title: No evidence of a pledge

statement: Algeria "wanted to be taken off of the terror list" at the time it made an unreported donation to the Clinton Foundation.
title: Unreported, yes. But Algeria wasn't on terror list

statement: Austin has "gone from being the 24th most congested city just about 10 years ago to being the fourth most congested — more congested than NYC."

statement: "It’s estimated that 40 percent of all the guns that are sold in the United States occur with no background records check."

statement: Distracted driving such as texting behind the wheel is behind a rise in traffic deaths on Georgia roadways this year.
title: Put down the phone when you read this

statement: "About half of the presidents have been governors; half of them, senators."
title: UPDATED: 14 weren't a senator or a governor

statement: "I’m the only member of the House of Representatives who raised most of his campaign funds in the last election from small contributions of less than $200."
title: Grayson was No. 1, Wasserman Schultz No. 2

statement: "There's no statistical evidence that" a waiting period for handgun purchases "reduces violence whatsoever."

statement: The recently passed transportation funding bill is a billion-dollar tax increase for Georgians.

statement: The money the Clinton Foundation took from from foreign governments while Hillary Clinton was secretary of state "is clearly illegal. … The Constitution says you can’t take this stuff."

statement: "Of the 13 (Bill) Clinton speeches that fetched $500,000 or more, only two occurred during the years his wife was not secretary of state."

statement: "Hillary Clinton’s State Department sent three comedians to India on the ‘Make Chai, Not War’ tour."
title: No joke

statement: "Fifteen years ago, you couldn't even get a pizza delivered in that neighborhood."

statement: The Castro regime ‘violated international norms’ by secretly shipping weapons to North Korea in violation of a U.N. embargo.
title: President wants Cuba off list of state sponsors of terrorism

statement: "More astronauts have been to the moon than farmers who paid the inheritance tax in 2013."
title: It doesn't affect that many farmers

statement: "I can tell you with certainty (cap and trade) would have a devastating impact on our economy."

statement: "We're not allowed to read it (the Trans-Pacific Partnership) before representatives vote on it."
title: Conflating two related, but separate, votes

statement: "Americans will spend more on taxes in 2015 than on food, clothing and housing combined."
title: Collectively, yes, but not true for many individuals

statement: "Rosalyn Dance voted against President Obama’s Medicaid expansion."

statement: "The unemployment rate among blacks in Texas is 9.5% -- far more than double white unemployment -- and wages have fallen for black workers in Texas since 2000."

statement: "America has lost over 50,000 manufacturing factories on other trade deals."

statement: "Medicaid patients were 97 percent more likely to die than those with private insurance."

statement: $29 is what "families on SNAP (i.e. food stamps) have to live on for a week."

statement: Women make only 78 percent of what men make for the same job.

statement: "We have an 80 percent graduation rate in high school after spending more per student than any country in the world other than Liechtenstein, I think, or Luxembourg and a couple other small countries."

statement: "The United States invented the community college. Nobody else had ever done anything like it."
title: A genuine American innovation

statement: "The fastest-growing part of the Pentagon’s budget are health care expenses."

statement: In recent polling in battleground states, a "majority of the people" said Hillary Clinton "is untrustworthy."
title: Numbers don't favor Clinton, but no majority in most swing states

statement: "Medicaid expansion isn’t necessarily a very popular issue on the street."

statement: Says Loretta Lynch’s nomination "has been now sitting there longer than the previous seven attorney general nominees combined."

statement: Says Hillary Clinton took "money from kings of Saudi Arabia and Morocco and Oman and Yemen."

statement: "By age 65, the average woman will have lost $431,000 throughout her working career was a result of the pay gap."

statement: Georgia has had the nation’s busiest Court of Appeals for a decade or more.

statement: "99 percent of all new income today (is) going to the top 1 percent."
title: The 1% is raking in the recovery

statement: The Hyde Amendment "language was in the (human trafficking) bill. The Democratic sponsor admits it was in the bill, and she voted for it."
title: Democrats claim they were duped

statement: "More than 30 cents of every state tax dollar goes to Medicaid."

statement: "ISIS camp a few miles from Texas, Mexican authorities confirm."

statement: "American families work hard to earn $4,250 a month. Obama is spending $18,972 a month on each illegal immigrant child."

statement: "The elimination of essentially every automobile would be offset by one volcano exploding."

statement: "The president and vice president can't be from the same state."
title: You can do it, but it can create a headache

statement: Says "all my grandparents" immigrated to America.
title: One, certainly not all

statement: "We are in the sixth year of recovery, and median income is below what it was at the start of the recovery."
title: Jobs picture is improving, but not income

statement: "When the Constitution was written, (only) 20 to 25 percent of the people in the country could vote."

statement: Says Howard Zinn, "an anti-American Marxist," wrote "the most popular textbook that's taught in our high schools in America."

statement: Florida has the most concealed weapon permits in the nation, "nearly double that of the second state, which is Texas."

statement: In Wisconsin, a "second arrest for carrying pot is a felony," but a second or subsequent arrest "for carrying a gun illegally is a misdemeanor."

statement: "U.S. police killed more people in just one month than the U.K.’s did in over a century."

statement: "Legislation being considered in Texas would strip the salaries and pensions of clerks who issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples — even if the Supreme Court strikes down Texas’ marriage ban later this year."

statement: A $5-a-night hotel/motel tax that’s part of the transportation bill will hurt Georgia’s convention business by adding extra costs for large groups coming to the state.

statement: Says Rand Paul denied that he "put forward a bill ... to zero out foreign aid and specifically spoke about Israel."

statement: "The same federal government that offers some money for a program is walking away from another health care program."

statement: Says Marco Rubio "voted to deport" young people known as Dreamers.

statement: This year’s state budget and my spending proposal for Fiscal Year 2016 represent an infusion of more than $1 billion in additional money for K-12 education.

statement: "Ninety percent of American workers don't own their own business."

statement: Says Bill Clinton signed a law "very similar to," and Barack Obama voted for a law "something like," Indiana's Religious Freedom Restoration Act.

statement: Repealing Obamacare saves "our nation more than $2 trillion."

statement: Says Hillary Clinton "erased all of her emails even though they were subject to recall and review by Congress."

statement: Says Hillary Clinton "completely ignored" "dozens and dozens of requests for more security" for the Benghazi consulate.

statement: "In the early 1980s, Sen. Edward Kennedy secretly offered to help Soviet leaders counter the Reagan administration’s position on nuclear disarmament."

statement: "The founders of New Hampshire came up with the motto Live Free or Die."

statement: Wisconsin’s attorney general and state treasurer ordered the daughter of Earth Day founder Gaylord Nelson not to discuss climate change on state time.

statement: Facebook has unveiled new rules to stop their users from creating posts related in any way to religion.

statement: The Georgia Legislature’s last day of session ends at midnight.

statement: "Wholly domestic communication between you and your wife can go to New York to London and back and get caught up in the (NSA) database."

statement: Says U.S. Rep. Patrick Murphy has "sided with the GOP on key votes twice as often as he sided with Democrats."

statement: "You can’t build a Christian church in Saudi Arabia."

statement: "Debt doubled" under Bush "and now it’s tripling under Barack Obama’s watch."

statement: "Iran’s defense budget is $30 billion. Our defense budget is closer to $600 billion."

statement: "Half of all Americans have less than $10,000 in their savings account."

statement: "Suntrust Bank cancels account because company sells guns."

statement: Says Ted Cruz said, "There is no place for gays or atheists in my America. None. Our Constitution makes that clear."

statement: "We have towns in West Texas that are out of water, that are having to truck in water."

statement: Seventy percent of Americans "don't have a college degree."

source: Foundation for a Secure and Prosperous America
statement: "Rand Paul supports Obama's negotiations with Iran."

statement: "Just two weeks ago, Congressman Hurd quit his post on the House Committee on Small Business saying that he was unable to find the time to serve."

statement: Under Barack Obama, "the average cost of family health care premiums has increased by $4,154."

statement: Lawmakers were paid for their off-season efforts to, for the first time, take the lead in drawing borders for two would-be cities.

statement: Says President Ronald Reagan "had a month of job creation of 1 million."
title: Based on a debunked claim

statement: "You know how many children in the history of the United States have died in a fire (at school)? Zero."

statement: Says Hillary Clinton will receive her "congressional salary until she dies" and the Secret Service pays her mortgage.
title: Vintage Internet rumor returns

statement: Says Indiana Gov. Mike Pence "provides zero state funding for homeless shelters."

statement: Virginia House Speaker Bill Howell is "allied to group pushing MIXED SEX BATHROOMS in Stafford Schools."

statement: "Did you know that the U.S. is one of the very few nations in the world without an official language?"
title: Es verdad

statement: Says he "paid one dollar for" a sweater at Kohl’s.
title: Clearance rack + Kohl's Cash = Campaign speech applause line

statement: An April 7, 2015 referendum would take "the choice of chief justice" of the Wisconsin Supreme Court "away from the people."

statement: Say Apple’s Tim Cook "will not do business with Indiana."

statement: "In this last election in November, ... 63 percent of the American people chose not to vote, ... 80 percent of young people, (and) 75 percent of low-income workers chose not to vote."

statement: A school uniform policy helps with "school safety, helps with truancy."

statement: "White men account for 69 percent of those arrested for violent crimes."

statement: By allowing brewpubs to sell beer, Georgia could become like Mexico with only a couple of manufacturers controlling all aspects of market.

statement: Despite raising taxes on the wealthy and hiking the minimum wage, Minnesota "is creating jobs at a record pace, unemployment is at a historic low, median income is skyrocketing, and (the) state has a billion-dollar surplus."

statement: "Not a single unarmed white person has been shot by the police" in New York in about 45 years.

statement: People buy more items during Georgia’s sales-tax holidays, boosting economic activity.
title: Most people shift buying but don't spend more

statement: "Florida has a law like (Indiana's Religious Freedom Restoration Act)."

statement: In the United States, we’ve had "12 years in a row of wages declining."

statement: The Affordable Care Act is "a major reason why we’ve seen 50,000 fewer preventable patient deaths in hospitals."

statement: "White people control almost 90 percent of the nation's wealth."

statement: Georgia has one of the nation’s highest jet fuel taxes.

statement: "Today roughly half of born-again Christians aren’t voting. They’re staying home."
title: UPDATED: True--in 2000

statement: "Inflation-adjusted defense spending has declined 21 percent since 2010, and even if we discount the drawdowns in Iraq and Afghanistan, it has still declined by a dangerous 12 percent."

statement: "Since President Obama took office in January 2009, the federal government has issued more than 468,500 pages of regulations."

statement: Says Barack Obama voted for the "very same language" of Indiana's Religious Freedom Restoration Act when he was in the Illinois state Senate. Sexual orientation "doesn't have anything to do with this law."

statement: "There's just one piece of legislation that is now law" with Sen. Ted Cruz's "name on it."

statement: "Rhode Island has the second highest per enrollee (Medicaid) cost of any state in the country, which is 60 percent higher than the national average."

statement: "If you took every penny of the 1 percent, including their dog, you wouldn't even begin to balance the budget."

statement: Says Ted Cruz just flip-flopped about the president needing to be U.S.-born.

statement: "From 2013-2015, the richest 14 Americans increased their net wealth by more than $157 billion, yet the Republican budget would not require these Americans to contribute one penny to deficit reduction."

statement: Florida is "one of the few states that has actually had a narrowing of the achievement gap based on income, or based on race or ethnicity."

statement: Says Gov. Scott Walker "has been rated America’s most factually-challenged politician."

statement: Under current conditions, by 2023, the interest payments on the national debt will be $722 billion, larger than the projected defense spending of $696 billion.

statement: Say Michelle Obama "mandates" weighing children in day care.

statement: "EPA wants to regulate … the family BBQ."

statement: Dallas "African-American and Hispanic students pass AP exams at a higher rate than any other place in America."

statement: Liberty University students "were mandated" to attend Sen. Ted Cruz’s presidential announcement "or they would be fined."

statement: Says according to recent polls, no Republican candidate "is doing better against Hillary Clinton than myself."

statement: Says Gov. Scott Walker’s proposed reduction in university spending is "about the size of the one" under Democratic Gov. Jim Doyle, but Democrats didn’t treat Doyle’s cut as so dire.

statement: Ted Cruz was "the longest-serving solicitor general in the history of Texas."

statement: "Obama has been sending taxpayer dollars, at least $350,000 to fund anti-Likud, anti-Netanyahu groups in Israel for (the) election."

statement: U.S. Rep. Patrick Murphy "voted to allow members of Congress to receive taxpayer-funded health care for life."

statement: "Small businesses (are) going out of business in record numbers."

statement: Job growth in the United States is now at the "fastest pace in this country's history."

statement: "Whales live as long at SeaWorld" as they do in the wild.
title: New data says differences have waned

statement: Recent solar energy policies in Georgia "have resulted in rate hikes and did not result in solar becoming any more economically viable."

statement: Creflo Dollar needed a $65 million Gulfstream G650 to carry thousands of pounds of food and other supplies -- as well as the Word of God -- worldwide.

statement: Under New York Mayor Bill de Blasio, homicides are up by 20 percent, and subway delays have soared 45 percent.

statement: "We've got 40 years of study now that show that, with a good preschool start, you're less likely to be on public dole, you're less likely to be in prison."
title: But there's some debate

statement: "According to the state of Florida, you are almost twice as likely to be attacked by an alligator than by someone who happens to carry a conceal-and-carry permit."

statement: "More than 7,000 Americans lost their lives to climate change-fueled events last year."
title: Beyer beware

statement: "The average faculty member at UW-Madison brings in close to a quarter million dollars a year" in grant money.

statement: State lawmakers are spending taxpayer money for parking that billionaire Arthur Blank could build while paying some state employees so little they are on food stamps.
title: picking budget priorities

statement: The IAEA, or the International Atomic Energy Agency, "last month said the Iranians are not currently living up to their obligations."

statement: Says Israel Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu "didn't change his position" on a two-state solution.
title: All aboard the post-election walk-back tour!

statement: "In an average grocery store, roughly 75 percent of processed foods contain genetically modified organisms, or GMOs."
title: The foods are common, organisms in the food are not

statement: "Many of the alarmists on global warming, they’ve got a problem because the science doesn’t back them up. In particular, satellite data demonstrate for the last 17 years, there’s been zero warming."
title: My world's on fire, how 'bout yours?

statement: "A few weeks ago Obama took Hamas and Iran OFF the terror list."
title: A point, buried under errors and hyperbole

statement: Beer drinking is not allowed in any Illinois state parks.
title: Actually less than half

statement: Uber and other ride-share firms are not required to carry auto insurance under Georgia law.
title: State rep right about lack of regulation

statement: Says "Jeb Bush has released 10 percent of his emails."
title: 90% would be closer

statement: Birth control pioneer Margaret Sanger was "an active participant in the Ku Klux Klan."
title: One speech does not an active member make

statement: The state of Florida has seen "double-digit drops" in alcohol use among teens.
title: According to an annual state survey

statement: In 2007, when Nancy Pelosi met with President Assad of Syria, "nobody got upset."
title: Lots of criticism when it happened

statement: Polling shows that nearly 74 percent of National Rifle Association members "support requiring background checks for all gun sales."

statement: "The stock market has almost tripled since April of 2009."
title: If you have a 401k, you'll feel richer

statement: Says Secretary of State John Kerry, "when he was a senator, flew to Managua and met with a communist dictator there, Daniel Ortega, and accused the Reagan administration of engaging in terrorism."
title: Reasonably accurate summation

statement: The delay in school testing "was not that of a vendor, the problem was not that of the test materials itself, it was the product of a cyber attack."
title: The vendor was also to blame for technical glitches

statement: Says that "Susan Rice, the president's national security adviser, has already conceded that Iran will have a robust uranium enrichment capability."
title: She didn't use those words

statement: Wisconsin is "dead last in the Midwest for job creation."
title: Tied for last

statement: The proposed transportation tax plan revokes a tax-credit for consumers’ electric cars while the state retains similar credits for similar vehicles for businesses.
title: State senate now weighing transportation plan

statement: "Every day, a black name resume is 50 percent less likely to get responded to than a white name resume."
title: Update: We all need to use a percent change calculator

statement: There was "just about zero press coverage" of the 2007 Bush White House email controversy.
title: More than zero, even allowing for hyperbole

statement: "Of the 10,000 Rhode Island children in charter school lotteries for the fall, more than 70 percent are poor .... In addition, a majority of them are students of color."
title: Numbers support her claim

statement: Says "Ted Kennedy sent a letter to then Soviet leader Yuri Andropov apologizing for Ronald Reagan and begging the Soviets not to overreact."

statement: "(Jeb) Bush, not the State of Florida, decided which private emails to disclose."
title: State law allows Bush to do that

statement: "Here, we have Thanksgiving, we have Christmas, we have the 4th of July. Every year in Iran, they celebrate Death to America day."
title: Annual demonstrations, not a holiday

statement: "We've seen the increase of alcohol use for underage kids even though alcohol has been illegal ... for kids under 21."

statement: Under legislation that has cleared the Georgia House, some children who are "legal refugees" could obtain state scholarships to attend private schools.
title: private school vouchers topic of bill

statement: A "majority of our students are trapped in" underperforming schools.
title: Texas rates most schools acceptable or better

statement: Medicaid is close to 30 percent of the state budget and "the biggest expenditure at the state."
title: Definitely a big chunk

statement: "The vast majority of our international commitments take effect without congressional approval."
title: It depends on what numbers you use

statement: "I unsealed my records" at Marquette University.
title: We haven't seen any documents, just statements

statement: Said former U.S. Ambassador to Kenya Scott Gration "was forced to resign two years ago because of his personal use of emails."

statement: Eliminating affirmative action in admissions in Florida led to "more African American and Hispanic kids attending our university system" than before.

statement: If President Barack Obama strikes a nuclear deal with Iran, "the next president could revoke such an executive agreement with the stroke of a pen and future Congresses could modify the terms of the agreement at any time."

statement: Georgia is one of only five states where breweries can’t sell you a pint of beer to drink on premise or sell you a six-pack to go.
title: Craft beer bill was watered down last week in committee

statement: "The Iranian parliament will get to say yes or no on this deal, and I think the United States Congress should have the exact same input into the process."
title: Even if true (it's not) would be symbolic

statement: Says Gov. Scott Walker’s proposed budget "would sell off Wisconsin’s state parks."
title: State parks claim oversold

statement: Says Hillary Clinton "sent a memo" to all State Department staff that said "you should not do State Department business on personal email."

statement: Today in Selma, Ala., "the poverty rate is roughly nine times that of whites."
title: There's a big racial gap, but not as big as he says

statement: "Black people are eight times more likely to be arrested than white people" in Madison.

statement: "Thomas Paine wrote that ‘the duty of a patriot is to protect his country from his government.’"
title: Ever hear of Edward Abbey?

statement: U.S. military involvement in Libya "allowed thousands of surface-to-air missiles to fall into the hands of radical Islamists."
title: US actually destroyed thousands of missiles

statement: The University of Wisconsin System "will be much more affordable than just about any other campus in America" because "going forward we have a cap on it tied to inflation."

statement: Every illegal immigrant "can be eligible for up to $36,000 to $38,000 in earned income tax credits without paying a dime in."

statement: "The State Department asked all secretaries of state to send their emails over." Hillary Clinton's "the only one who’s done it."

statement: "The labor participation rate is at an all-time low."
title: We'll try not to belabor the point

statement: "Contrary to popular belief, we actually don’t have that many public employees…We are well below average in the number of public employees.’’
title: Her numbers add up

statement: "Research performed by economists has shown no consistent, positive impact on jobs, income or tax revenues arising from stadiums or sports franchises."

statement: "There are at least three sectors of the border, one in particular, that are just completely insecure."

statement: A recent economic uptick appears to "coincide" with "the expectation of a new Republican Congress."

statement: Under the "cromnibus" law, taxpayers must guarantee "incredibly risky" derivatives deals made by the nation's largest banks.

statement: Only 42 percent of young Georgians have a college certificate or degree, but soon 60 percent of jobs will require some college credential.

statement: "Newly Elected Republican Senators Sign Pledge to Eliminate Food Stamp Program in 2015."

statement: "Fox News airs Stuart Scott R.I.P. tribute with picture of Stephen A. Smith."

statement: New tax increases that went into effect on Jan. 1, 2015, "all passed under the Affordable Care Act, aka Obamacare."

statement: "We're now the No. 1 producer of oil in the world. We've surpassed Saudi Arabia."

statement: Children who witness domestic violence are "twice as likely to commit it themselves."

statement: "Income inequality is worse in towns run by Democrat mayors than in towns run by Republican mayors."

statement: Greg Abbott did "nothing" to pursue reports of the sexual abuse of boys at a West Texas state-run school.

statement: "You have 200,000 to 400,000 military veterans on the street in this country on any given day."

statement: Says Dick Cheney "de-Ba’athisized the Iraqi government and created ISIS."

statement: "As chair of the Senate Education Committee, I led the charge to restore most of the education cuts from last session."

statement: Says "Nick Rahall voted with Obama 94 percent of the time."

statement: Women still do not get paid as much as men, even "for the same work, period."

statement: Says Gina Raimondo's "venture capital firm secured a secret no-bid contract funded by taxpayers."

statement: "I sponsored the new Buy American law"

statement: In Texas public schools, "we spend an average of $12,000 per pupil per year."

statement: Jorge Elorza "wants to impose a municipal income tax."

statement: Africa is spending "the highest percentage of their GDP on education of any part of the world."

statement: Women "own just 1 percent of the world’s land."

statement: Israel in the last three weeks has "killed more Palestinian children, more than 200, than the total number of Israeli soldiers killed in military operations since 2006."

statement: "The average minimum wage worker is 35 years old."

statement: "Some of the wealthiest Americans are African-American now."

statement: "No other country has a constitutional right" like the Second Amendment.

statement: David Perdue supports Common Core

statement: 40 percent of illegal immigrants "had a visa and then became illegal," mostly because "they changed jobs."

statement: Dan Patrick "got caught not paying his taxes" and "pocketed his employees’ payroll taxes."

statement: "The Constitution simply does not authorize the federal government to own any of this land (in the Western states)."

statement: "Over 20 percent of the electorate is Hispanic" in Florida.

statement: "I am the only senator who turned down the state pension plan for part-time legislators."

statement: "95 percent of the income gains in the last few years have gone to the top 1 percent."

statement: "In 2013 we had the largest, the best, private sector job growth we’ve had in this state since the 1990s."

statement: Ryan Sitton’s company "accepted over $650,000 in Obama stimulus dollars."

statement: Says a pro-Democratic ad is "false" for saying that he allowed two disgraced staffers in 2012 to "resign."

statement: "Over 300K home owner suicides attributed to foreclosures."

statement: Says Cory Gardner "championed an eight-year crusade to outlaw birth control here in Colorado."

statement: Says Charlie Crist's campaign bashed Sen. Bill Nelson's "big-government solutions."

statement: Says he hasn’t changed his view on abortion restrictions.

statement: Women are paid 77 cents for every $1 men get for the same work.

statement: "Did you know US population growth is at its lowest since the Great Depression?"

statement: "The U.S. spends more money on its military than the 16 biggest military budgets in the world" combined.

statement: More "25- to 34-year-olds are moving to Austin than any other city in America."

statement: Says President Barack Obama was responsible for "the assassination of at least four American citizens" in drone strikes.

statement: Says he has supported "George Bush more than I have Barack Obama."

statement: A "real result" of his term is Georgia having "the lowest taxes per capita of any state."

statement: "The majority support (raising) the minimum wage."

statement: "We have the lowest beer tax in the nation."

statement: The minimum wage "in real terms right now is below where it was when Harry Truman was in office."

statement: "44% of homeless people are employed."

statement: "Residents could have received nearly $48M for Local Schools, Fire District, Sheriff’s Dept. and Social Services."

statement: "We, the bishops of the United States -- can you believe it -- in 1919 came out for more affordable, more comprehensive, more universal health care."

statement: "Back door gun control is in full effect in the United States" due to "Obama’s Environmental Protection Agency."

statement: Says in the last five years "Senate Republicans have placed a filibuster on every piece of legislation and every nominee."

statement: "I did not support the sequester."

statement: Louie Gohmert of Texas "blamed the mass shooting at a movie theater in Colorado on ‘the ongoing attacks on Judeo-Christian beliefs.'"

statement: Louie Gohmert of Texas "compared the current general-in-charge in Egypt to George Washington."

statement: "Violent crime is up since the last year of Sharpe James’ administration. This year it’s higher. … The unemployment rate is almost 15 percent. The high school dropout rate is over 50 percent."

statement: Says Democratic gubernatorial candidate Mary Burke "has proven on the Madison Board of Education" that she supports raising taxes and spending.

statement: "Many don’t know that Bill Young was once the minority leader in the Florida Senate...because he was the only Republican senator."

statement: Says "between 6 and 20 bicycles can be parked in the space required by one car."
title: Twelve is more like it.

statement: I am "the only candidate for lieutenant governor to oppose in-state tuition for illegal immigrants."

statement: Says Sen. Mark Pryor voted for "special subsidies" for lawmakers and staff in Congress "so they’re protected from Obamacare."

statement: The health care marketplaces have "no privacy protections."
title: Sites are slow, but they have privacy protection

statement: Says her actions as Wisconsin commerce secretary brought the state "84,000 more Wisconsin jobs than we have today."
title: More at work than her work, including that Great Recession thing

statement: Any state tax law has to start in the House and the renewal of the state hospital bed tax this year started in the Senate, which is unconstitutional.

statement: "For the first time since the Korean War, total federal spending has gone down for two years in a row."
title: Yes, the first time in quite a while

statement: Because of the 2011 debt ceiling fight, "the stock market lost 2,000 points."

statement: "Nobody's addicted to" marijuana.

statement: "Every month, we get the reports from the Bureau of Labor Statistics that say even more people have given up looking for work."

statement: The Obama administration shut down the Amber Alert program because of the government shutdown.

statement: "Obama has jumped the shark and ordered the ocean closed!"

statement: There is "a constitutional issue" that affects "the paychecks of members of Congress" during a shutdown.

statement: "This year, the federal government will have more revenue than any year in the history of our country."

statement: Says David Dewhurst "went out for drinks" during Senate debate on abortion bill.

statement: Virginia is "the number one state per capita in screening out people with mental illness from gun purchases."

statement: Domestic violence "is seen as a pre-existing" health condition and "women had to pay 50 percent more for health care because of gender ratings," but under Obamacare, "all of that is over."

statement: Forty-six states have a line-item veto for the governor.

statement: Says a man opted out of Obamacare after the marketplace launched on Oct. 1, 2013, and was informed he owed a $4,000 fine.
title: Widely shared, but none of it makes much sense

statement: Only "four countries in the world… allow abortions after 20 weeks" of pregnancy.

statement: "Eighty-five percent of government's running right now. Only 15 percent of government spending is shut down."

statement: The growth in health care costs "has been reined in through the Affordable Care Act."

statement: "At the time that (Medicare Part D) was passed (it) was actually less popular than the Affordable Care Act, according to the polls."

statement: Shutdowns are "a normal part of the constitutional process," with 12 shutdowns under Democratic House Speaker Tip O’Neill and two during his own speakership.

statement: The shutdown is projected to result in "$10 billion in costs to the economy per week."

statement: "Obama Declares November National Muslim Appreciation Month."

statement: Among the nation’s 51 largest metropolitan areas, Milwaukee is the "only one" where the poverty rate is more than "four times greater in the city than it is in the suburbs."

statement: Ken Cuccinelli "tried to shut down" state government.

statement: "(Texas Republicans) believe in abolishing Social Security, abolishing V.A. health care."

statement: The crime rate in some Atlanta neighborhoods has dropped by 35 to 51 percent.

statement: In a "sweetheart deal … members of Congress, thanks to the Obama administration, are going to be the only people in America to get subsidies in the Obamacare exchanges."

statement: "In 2010, the non-partisan Government Accountability Office found that only 6.5 percent of the U.S.-Mexico border was under full control of the Border Patrol."

statement: "In states where the federal government helps run these (health care) marketplaces, the average American will have more than 50 different plans to choose from, with different levels of coverage."

source: League of Women Voters of Texas Education Fund
statement: "Photo ID is not required for those who vote by mail."

statement: "For the last decade, Floridians’ salaries have shrunk substantially" when adjusted for inflation.

statement: Says "Nathan Deal killed pro-gun bills in 2013."

statement: "A strong bipartisan majority" in the House of Representatives "voted to defund Obamacare."

statement: "The United States Senate — Democrats and Republicans — (voted) to keep our government open."

statement: "Many state and federal agencies have such ‘navigators’ involved in helping folks maneuver through the often complex processes associated with filing benefits claims, for example -- even buying health insurance."

statement: "I would be the first Republican senator elected in New Jersey in 41 years."

statement: "There are still tens of thousands of missing service members from previous and current conflicts that our nation is working to find and repatriate."

statement: The highest paid employee of the State of Rhode Island is a basketball coach.

statement: Says Maggie Hassan is the only female governor in the country.

statement: Under economic sanctions, "now Iran is suffering 30 percent inflation, 20 percent unemployment."

statement: "Up to half of all Americans have a pre-existing condition."

statement: Warren Buffett says stop Obamacare now and start over.

statement: "One out of four corporations doesn't pay a nickel in (federal income) taxes."

statement: UPS left 15,000 employees’ spouses "without health insurance" and told them to, "go on an exchange with no employer subsidy."

statement: "(Obamacare) is a bill which has never once had a majority of Americans favor it."

statement: Says Ken Cuccinelli tried to make it more difficult for mothers to obtain divorces.

statement: "Today many Florida teachers are at risk of having their pay impacted by the performance of children who are not even in their classrooms or subject areas."

statement: "According to the Congressional Budget Office, repealing Obamacare would increase the budget deficit."

statement: The U.S. Supreme Court decided in 1982 that non-citizen children must get free K-12 education.

statement: "Unlike you and me, Congress gets to keep up to $11,000 a year in taxpayer subsidies" under Obamacare.

statement: If the government shuts down, "all military personnel will continue to serve and accrue pay but will not actually be paid until appropriations are available."

statement: Mental health provisions related to mass shootings "got over 90 votes in the Senate."

statement: "The American people support defunding Obamacare and oppose shutting down the government."

statement: "You have to get a license to fish on our beaches."

statement: "Governor Deal has increased education spending every year he’s been in office."

statement: "Terry McAuliffe cashed in, walking away with millions" from the demise of Global Crossing.

statement: Tuition at Rutgers has increased 10 percent since Gov. Chris Christie took office because he "cut funding for higher education."

statement: Since 2007, "Texas has gained 440,000 people" while "Maryland has lost 20,000."

statement: "There are more guns than there are people in the United States."

statement: An average of seven children in America are killed by guns every day.

statement: "Soy ... el único official estatal quién es un hombre de negocios."

statement: The very first meal on the surface of the moon was the Holy Communion.

statement: "Trenton politicians cut $1.3 billion from education."

statement: Says Gov. Scott Walker "hasn't done a public event this entire year."

statement: "Wind power is the most undependable form of renewable energy."

statement: "Over the past twenty years, the number of homicides committed with a firearm in the United States has decreased by nearly 40 percent. The number of other crimes involving the use of a firearm has also plummeted, declining by nearly 70 percent."

statement: Salaries for URI faculty are second to last among New England land grant universities and in lowest 20 percent of major U.S. research institutions

statement: An account of attacks in Benghazi written by former White House press secretary Dee Dee Myers shows that the body of U.S. Ambassador to Libya Christopher Stevens was "dragged through the streets" and abused.

statement: "We cut business taxes so today 70 percent of our businesses don't pay a business tax."

statement: "We will have the highest general revenue in state history next year. Conservative pro-growth policies work in our state."

statement: "Rep. Frank Wolf voted to allow terror suspects to buy guns."

statement: About 40 percent of U.S. illegal immigrants "came in on an airplane, with a legal visa, and just overstayed their visa and have never gone home."

statement: The number of African-American men in prison has increased fivefold since he left office.

statement: Says every day of a special session costs taxpayers $40,000.
title: Special sessions cost quite a bit less than the regular variety.

statement: Says Obama "exempted Congress and their staff from the full effect of the (health care) law."

statement: According to a recent poll, "there are more young Republicans enrolled in their parents' (health insurance) plans than young Democrats."

statement: Says there's a "100-year-old international norm not to use chemical weapons."

statement: "The average family premium has increased by 29% under Obama!"

statement: "The House did vote against engagement in Kosovo, and Bill Clinton kept fighting anyway. And, then, ultimately, a vote did pass."

statement: A proposed San Antonio ordinance will allow men into women’s restrooms in the city.

statement: Americans spend more than $160 billion and 6 billion hours per year complying with the tax code.

statement: Under the Endangered Species Act, "only 1 percent of the species that have been listed have actually been delisted."

statement: Fleeing Syria, "a million children are now refugees."

statement: "There’s only one candidate under investigation -- Terry McAuliffe."

statement: Obamacare-caused paperwork will annually absorb 190 million hours or more--and Mount Rushmore could be built 1,547 times over "with the paperwork."

statement: "The city of Portland has won more national Constitution contests than any city in America."

statement: Says Ken Cuccinelli supported a law that could allow people to carry missile launchers into airports.

statement: Congress secured special Obamacare rules "to prevent their healthcare costs from rising."

statement: Because of Gov. Scott Walker’s budgeting, a greater percentage of general fund tax dollars is "going to pay off debt than ever before in our history."

statement: Says Cory Booker "supports late-term and partial-birth abortion and opposes safety regulations."

statement: "Minnesota, Michigan, Iowa already have 70 mph" speed limits on rural interstates, and "we see that they’ve been able to do it safely."

statement: The R.I. Turnpike and Bridge Authority "was supposed to exist only until the bonds used to build the Newport Bridge were paid off through tolls. Once the bonds were paid, the Newport Bridge was to be transferred to the State of Rhode Island and become toll-free."

statement: Half of Oregon university students are on Pell Grants.

statement: Offshore wind power is "significantly less expensive than solar energy."

statement: "Every year, more than $40 million are leaving Missouri for the Lone Star State."

statement: "We are about halfway" to the president’s goal to cut greenhouse gas emissions and "about half of that is because of the substitution of natural gas for coal in the power sector."

statement: Says that "unlike Texas, Missouri has a perfect AAA credit rating."

statement: South Carolina has "the fastest-growing economy in the Southeast."

statement: "While fat-cat bureaucrats at the Department of Education are getting paid an average salary of $102,000 a year, teachers in Georgia are getting paid half of that."
